risks.name: Outdated Policy Framework
risks.description: Without regular reviews, the policy may fall behind current stakeholder expectations or regulatory requirements, leading to misaligned practices.

risks.name: Lack of Cross-Functional Oversight
risks.description: If reviews are not conducted by a cross-functional team, emerging risks or gaps in stakeholder engagement may be overlooked.

controls.name: Regular Policy and ESG Review
controls.description: Conduct frequent reviews by the ESG team to ensure that the policy remains current and aligned with evolving stakeholder needs, best practices, and regulatory standards.

controls.name: Cross-Functional Review Committees
controls.description: Establish committees with representation from various departments to provide comprehensive oversight and timely updates to the policy.

risks.name: Ineffective Communication
risks.description: Failure to use the appropriate communication channels may cause misinterpretation of messages, reduced trust, and stakeholder disengagement.

risks.name: Inconsistent Engagement
risks.description: Irregular or insufficient engagement with stakeholders can lead to disengagement and missed opportunities for critical feedback.

risks.name: Ineffective Feedback Capture
risks.description: A lack of structured feedback mechanisms may result in inadequate tracking and response to stakeholder concerns, reducing the effectiveness of engagement.

controls.name: Multi-Channel Communication Strategy
controls.description: Adopt numerous engagement channels (customer surveys, digital platforms, meetings, physical interactions, etc.) to ensure clear, timely, and transparent communication.

controls.name: Regular Engagement Scheduling
controls.description: Establish scheduled, continuous engagements (e.g., periodic surveys, annual meetings, ongoing digital interactions) to maintain consistent dialogue with stakeholders.

controls.name: Stakeholder Matrix and Feedback Mechanism
controls.description: Utilize a stakeholder matrix to document issues and feedback, ensuring concerns are noted, assessed, and mitigated appropriately.

risks.name: Inadequate Stakeholder Identification
risks.description: Failure to accurately identify all relevant internal and external stakeholders, which may result in overlooking key interests or emerging operational risks.

risks.name: Inaccurate Prioritization
risks.description: Mis-prioritizing stakeholders may lead to an ineffective engagement strategy and unaddressed critical issues.

controls.name: Comprehensive Stakeholder Analysis Framework
controls.description: Use systematic internal and external environmental analysis to identify all individuals, groups, and organizations that impact or are impacted by the company’s operations.

controls.name: Defined Prioritization Criteria
controls.description: Implement structured criteria based on legal obligations, influence on decision-making, and potential impact to properly prioritize stakeholders.
